PHP Fatal error: cannot redeclare class

1:
-

Mocking a collection Laravel


Cool way to mock an Eleqount query without relying on the DB.


$tickets = collect([
    (object) ['price' => 1200],
    (object) ['price' => 1200],
    (object) ['price' => 1200],
]);

Fun fact:
All collections items you get when you are using the query builder are instances of PHP stdClass.
2:
Mac OSX system path not working

I was trying to add a new path to the systems path via both /etc/paths and .bash_profile but the terminal would not get it on echo $PATH.


The problem was that I am using a shell called Fish which means that you have to set the systems path another place.


Here is how I solved it


Create new fish config file:
$ touch ~/.config/fish/config.fish


Open config file:
$ nano ~/.config/fish/config.fish


Insert path to file:
ยง echo set -gx PATH \$PATH


Then CTRL + X and yes to save, then restart terminal and you a good to go.
3:
Change Vue state from console

You can just call the instance with $vm + instance number. The number will also be referenced in the developer tool on the right from the component.


Example:


new Vue({
    el: "#one"
    data: {
        name: "john"
    }
}); 

new Vue({
    el: "#two"
    data: {
        name: "sara"
    }
}); 

$vm0.name // john
$vm1.name // sara

5:
UTF-8 encoding in PHP

According to the Podcast PHP Roundtable the best encoding to MySQL is utf8mb4 as this supports all the UTF-8 characters.



  • Remember to use <meta charset="utf-8"> in HTML head.

  • In a form you can use <form enctype="text/plain; charset=utf-8">.

  • In HTTP use Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8.

  • Always use <meta> and a Content-Type header.


Link: https://www.phproundtable.com/episode/character-encoding-and-utf-8-in-php


Very good episode.

7:
Laravel Drop Unique Index

I was trying to drop an unique index via php artisan migrate but got an error which said I could not drop the column i was trying to remove the unique key from.


This is the failing code:


public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('title');
        });
}

public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

`


The problem was I that dropUnique needs a full path/name for the index.


Working example:


public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('news_title_unique');
        });
}

public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

So dropUnique get first the table "news" then the column "title" and then the unique key "unique" all in all "newstitleunique".

12:
Optional Callback in JavaScript

Sometimes you need a callback to be optional.
function crush(material, cb){
// Crush material
console.log(material + " has been crushed");
// Callback
if (cb && typeof(cb) === "function") {
cb();
}
}


crush("stone");


crush("stone", function(){
console.log("Good job");
});


Link:
http://codepen.io/johnbrowe/pen/oBbVwO?editors=1111
13:
Undefined offset: 0

Once in a while you get a exception like this one.


ErrorException in Collection.php line 1187:
Undefined offset: 0 (View: /home/vagrant/Code/.../resources/views/.../index.blade.php)


And if this error occurs in Laravel you are quick to panic and run away to Google I know I do.


But most likely this is an error that occurs when you are trying to access a key that does not exists in an array.


Example:


$list = ["Sara", "Tinna", "John"];
echo $list[0]; // "Sara"
echo $list[2]; // "John"
echo $list[3]; // Undefined offset: 3 :4


So just go through your view file at figure out where you are trying to access a key that does not exist.

19:
Connecting to MongoDB Debian VM

Working on a new project I needed to connect to at MongoDB instance on a Debian virtual machine.


I had many multiple problem firstly installing the right version of Mongo and futher more connecting to the MongoDB with Robomongo.


I tried multiple different installs but nothing really worked.


But I found a solution on SO where it said I should commment out bind_ip = 127.0.0.1 and so I did.


Edit mongod.conf:
sudo nano /etc/mongod.conf


Comment out bind_p:


bind_ip = 127.0.0.1


Restart MongoDB:
sudo service mongod restart


Here are some other usefull command for debugging MongoDB:
ps -ef | grep mongo
lsof -i -ac mongod
sudo service mongod status
sudo lsof -iTCP -sTCP:LISTEN | grep mongo

31:
All input not showing on submit

I got a bug on on of my web apps as newly created products where not being sent when I submitted the form.


Every input looked good in the form and I just many many many hours trying to debug this issue.


The problem was PHP has a default security setting that says PHP will not receive more than 1000 input fields. And i was sending about 1100 fields meaning that last 100 input fields would not show up. It just ignores the rest and will not send an error.


If you are using the Apache the fix is simple just add these lines to you .htaccess file.
phpvalue maxinputvars 6000
phpvalue suhosin.post.maxvars 6000
phpvalue suhosin.request.max_vars 6000


And you are good to go.


On Nginx you need to edit the php.ini file, and uncomment the line with maxinputvars and set it to a higher number.


If you are not sure where the php.ini is located just use the phpinfo(); function.


There will be a row called "Loaded Configuration File" which will tell you the path to the php.ini file.


The path will be something like this /etc/php/7.0/php.ini.


So to edit you could use a line like as this.


nano /etc/php/7.0/php.ini


It will look like this:
; maxinputvars = 1000


I changed mine to this:
maxinputvars = 4000


After this you have to restart php process manager with this command:


/etc/init.d/php7.0-fpm restart


Now it should work

36:
My first extension Chrome extension

I have always wondered how a Chrome extension works.
Now I know.


I needed to set a cookie with an ID onload every time the browser was updated locally to emulate a cloud service.


I found out it is quite simple to setup.


I created a folder called add_cookie with two files:


add_cookie/
- content.js
- manifest.js


In manifest.js I inserted this code:


// Manifest
{
"manifestversion": 2,
"name": "Add Cookie Local",
"version": "0.1",
"contentscripts": [
{
"matches": [
""
],
"js": ["content.js"]
}
]
}


In content.js is just set the cookie:


// content.js
document.cookie = "Ely_vID=114p93086";


Upload the folder to chrome extension:
settings => Extensions => Load unpacked extension

106. Set up xdebug with Homestead & PHPStorm

You need homestead box version 4.2.0 (versions before this do not have xdebug to php 7)


First ssh in to your homestead box:
vagrant up
Vagrant SSH


When you are ssh'd in type: (this will create a file called debug.ini, you can called it something else if you want)
sudo nano /etc/php/7.0/fpm/conf.d/debug.ini


add this snippet and save:
xdebug.remoteenable = 1
xdebug.remotehost = 10.0.2.2
xdebug.remote_port = 9000
xdebug.idekey = phpstorm


Add the right to the file:
sudo chmod a+x debug.ini


Install chrome extension:
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/xdebug-helper/eadndfjplgieldjbigjakmdgkmoaaaoc


Activate extention


Right click on extension icon and choose options:
set ide key dropdown to other and write phpstorm (in lowercase, should be same as xdebug.idekey)


PHPSTORM
Go to settings:
file -> settings -> languages & frameworks -> PHP -> Servers


Click:



  • (plus icon)


Name: Homestead (can be what ever you want)


Shared: uncheck


Host: your-local-domain-name.app (in my case johnhoj.app)


Port: 9000 (same as xdebug.remote_port)


Debugger: Xdebug


Use path mappings: check


right to the path to your project directory:
Double click (absolute path on the server)
Write the same path as your homestead.yaml folder to path is:
example: /home/vagrant/johnhoj


Then click apply.

For some kind of reason Mcrypt was not showing up in phpinfo after install.
It was though located in the mods_available folder.


Solution was to:

sudo service apache2 restart


Then it showed up in the phpinfo

59:
90. Snappy Laravel 4.2 problem (wkhtmltopdf)

I had some problems with getting Snappy Laravel (wkhtmltopdf) to work in my homestead box. Here are the steps to get it working:



  1. sudo apt-get install wkhtmltopdf (this will be located at /usr/bin directory)
    # you can cd to the dir example: cd /usr/bin and see if they are installed there

  2. sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf

  3. sudo apt-get install openssl build-essential xorg libssl-dev

  4. sudo /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf http://www.google.com test.pdf
    #Test if this works, in my machine it did not work and I had to do some more steps

  5. sudo apt-get install xvfb

  6. touch wkhtmltopdf.sh (this should be done in the /usr/bin/ folder)

  7. sudo nano wkhtmltopdf.sh

  8. add this line: xvfb-run wkhtmltopdf "$@"

  9. ctrl + o (to save)

  10. ctrl + x (to exit)

  11. wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com test.pdf (should create pdf file named test.pdf)
    # in my case I printed it out to /usr/test.pdf like this, because of permissions
    # wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com usr/test.pdf

  12. Now edit snappy config file mine is located in /app/config/packages/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/config.php
    # In some cases you will get permission denied

  13. If so you need to get the wkhtmltopdf.sh permission by writing: chmod +x filename.sh


Config.php file should look like this:


<?php


return array(


'pdf' => array(
    'enabled' => true,
    'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf.sh',
    'options' => array(),
),
'image' => array(
    'enabled' => true,
    'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltoimage.sh',
    'options' => array(),
),

);


If you donโt have a config read this documentation:
https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/tree/0.1


This link helped me on the right track.
Link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9604625/wkhtmltopdf-cannot-connect-to-x-server

83.Vue.js component inside component

File structure:
/Vue/app.js
/Vue/Components/parent.js
/Vue/Components/child.js


Here is app file:
new Vue({


el: "#app",

components: {
    'parent-component': require('./components/admin/parent')
}

});


// Parent component file
module.exports = {


// This is the important part    
components: {
    'counter': require('./counter')
},
ready: function(){}
data: function () {},
methods: {}

}


// Child component
module.exports =


{
template: '',
data: function () {
return { count: 0 }
}
methods: {}


};

76:
73. Find object property in Array

Im falling in love with underscore.


I needed to get the index of a name in a object in an array.


And underscore a has many options. I used this:


var users = [{'id': 1, 'name': 'Bob', 'last': 'Brown'},
{'id': 2, 'name': 'Ted', 'last': 'White'},
{'id': 3, 'name': 'Frank', 'last': 'James'},
{'id': 4, 'name': 'Ted', 'last': 'Jones'}];


_.findLastIndex(users, {
name: 'Ted'

HTML should look like this:




  • {{ $index }} - {{ parentMsg }} {{ item.childMsg }}


Javascript should look like this:
var demo = new Vue({
el: '#demo',
data: {
parentMsg: 'Hello',
items: [
{ childMsg: 'Foo' },
{ childMsg: 'Bar' },
{ childMsg: 'bla' },
{ childMsg: 'sma' }
]
},
methods: {
onClick: function (obj) {
console.log(obj.childMsg);
}
}
})


As you can see we pass the argument "onclick(item)" which is the same as the v-for item.

84:
65. Reset SSD Ubuntu 15.04

cd /dev/
sudo hdparm -I sda


Then it will show some text, we are interested in this part, specically the part that says frozen:


"
Security:
Master password revision code = 65534
supported
not enabled (this should be enabled)
not locked
frozen (this should be not frozen)
not expired: security count
supported: enhanced erase
4min for SECURITY ERASE UNIT. 2min for ENHANCED SECURITY ERASE UNIT.
"


We want it to say not frozen and enabled


To do this write:
systemctl suspend


The system will suspend and then start up again, when it does write "sudo hdparm -I sda" again.


Now it will say:
not frozen


Now type to change enabled to not enabled:
sudo hdparm --user-master u --security-set-pass A-pass-word sda


Then the cli will display:
security_password="A-pass-word"


If you type sudo "hdparm -I sda" it should say:


enabled (instead of not enabled)


Final step, which will wipe the SSD which mean everything on the SSD will be lost, so backup if have something on that want.


Now type:
hdparm --user-master u --security-erase A-pass-word sda


Links:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMir8LOXX6U
https://ata.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/ATASecureErase

86:
63. Could not ssh into server

I had forgotten all my credentials to a remote server, which I really wanted to log in to. It was a digitalocean server so I could just login to my account and reset the password.


After this I tried to ssh in to the server in any possible way, but I just could not.


When I wrote ssh root@ip_address


I got "permission denied".


So I figured out problem which was that I tried to ssh in with root and by default login in with root is not permitted.


To test if this was the case I accessed to web console droplet and wrote:
nano /etc/ssh/sshd_config


So in this file I changed "PermitRootLogin no" to "PermitRootLogin yes" and then:


sudo service ssh restart


After this I had not problem loggin in.


My guess is that there is a reason why root is not permitted login by default, so I changed it back "PermitRootLogin no" and figured out how to create another user.


Link: http://askubuntu.com/questions/497895/permission-denied-for-rootlocalhost-for-ssh-connection

90:
59. Kill Node process

Usually when you want to quit a node server you press CTRL + C or CTRL + Z.


But if you want to stop the Node server where you have killed of the terminal that you used to start Node.


You get this error if you try to start node again:


Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::3000
at Object.exports.errnoException (util.js:837:11)
at exports.exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:860:20)
at Server.listen2 (net.js:1231:14)
at listen (net.js:1267:10)
at Server.listen (net.js:1363:5)
at EventEmitter.listen (/root/my-site/nodemodules/express/lib/application.js:617:24)
at Object. (/root/my-site/index.js:33:5)
at Module.compile (module.js:434:26)
at Object.Module.extensions..js (module.js:452:10)
at Module.load (module.js:355:32)


You can fix this with:


Write:
ps aux | grep node


Find the process ID, which second from the left (in my case 4 digits) it should look something like this:


root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxxx xxxxx pts/0 Sl+ 09:18 0:00 node index.js
root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxx xxx pts/4 S+ 09:41 0:00 grep --color=au


Then write:
kill -9 PROCESS_ID


For example:
kill -9 4485


and then you are good to go.

42. Set path and enviroment variables Windows 7

Right-click the Computer icon and select Properties.
Click the Advanced System Settings it on the left hand side.
In the System Properties window, click on the Advanced tab, then click the Environment Variables.
In the Environment Variables window highlight the Path variable in the "System variables" section and click the Edit button.
Add or modify the path lines with the paths you want the computer to access.


You can also set the path via the command prompt (search: cmd)
For example I set my path when installing nodejs like this.
If the path is: C:\Program Files\Nodejs do like this.


This string will be set the enviroment variable til you close prompt:
SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Nodejs;%PATH%


This will set the variable for good:
setx path "%path%;C:\Program Files\Nodejs"


Links:
http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch000549.htm
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12155268/ruby-environment-variables

35. Vagrant Box stopped working

I got this error after updating homestead.


My solution was to delete current version, installing it again.
In my case when updating there where 2 box versions, I think this could have been the problem though im not sure.


Open command line and write:
vagrant box list


to see what boxes you have. In my case this was the result:
laravel/homestead (virtualbox, 0.2.5)
laravel/homestead (virtualbox, 0.2.6)


To delete them you write:
vagrant box remove laravel/homestead --box-version 0.2.5
vagrant box remove laravel/homestead --box-version 0.2.6


After that cd to the homestead folder and write:
vagrant add laravel/homestead

29. Debugging/Freezing Bootstrap tooltips & popover

It can be hard to style certain element because they disappear when you try to click on them.


This is certainly the case with Bootstrap tooltips & popovers, when you try to inspect the element it will disappear.


My solution is to this problem is to make them visible with JavaScript, here is how:


$('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip('show');


OR


$('[data-toggle="popover"]').popover('show');


then through the developer tool navigate through the HTML to the popover element which in this case will not disappear.

echo mb_strimwidth("Hello World", 0, 10, "...");

143:
Accessing illegal name properties from PHP Objects

I quite a long time to figure this one out.


I had a json decoded object where the object keys had some illegal characters "this-is-the-illegal-string".


This mean that the usual way will not work.


$array = ['hello' => 'John', 'hello-world' => 'John'];
$objext = (object)$array;
echo $object->['hello-world']; // This does not work

The solution is to use curly braces


echo $object->{'hello-world'}; // This works
144:
Express params

I just started using Express and had some problems on how to use params to display pages "blog" pages.


app.get('/notes/:note', function(req, res){

    var notes = require(__dirname + '/pages/content/notes.json');

    res.render(__dirname + '/pages/note', { note: note. [req.params.note]});    

});

You will notice that I use the :note after the path /notes/:note


This will catch the unknown params that are added to the path.


You can use this string/value with req.param.note


Note can ofcourse be what ever you want forexample :bla
then you would use req.param.bla to get the value.
145:
Relative CSS link

I typical mistake is to make CSS links relative by not using / at the start of the link.


<link href='css/main.css' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>

It should instead be:


<link href='/css/main.css' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>

Write more about this..........
